For fun, I send an unmarked mystery crate down to the hill. The contents are unknown to anyone - all we know is, the crate is called The Stig (and it's 2mx1mx1m in size).

Continues to watch the hill.

"Ladies and gentlemen, let the fiftieth Hunger Games begin!"

My crater

suddenly a shadow goes over everyone's hills. it's a floating hill made of unobtanium, and it has artillery on it to keep out intruders.

MY HILL

i shoot the weak spot landing a 4000000000HP critical hit, it collapses

my pile of hill

when the hill collapsed, it fell on a stray nuclear silo. the world esplodes.

MY... nothing.

You quickly suffocate and die. 

I then proceed to re-create the world and create the hill again (can you guys just leave it as a hill? Is it really so hard to war over hill without tearing it to atoms? Gawsh) and claim it before stepping into a fold of time and vanishing.

I claim the hill

My hill

I drop lots of Mann Co. Supply Crates to squash you, remove the crates, and build impenetrable bunkers, AA, and artillery.

My superultramega awesome hill.

queue badass scene involving jetpacks, swords, guns and loadsa explosions

my hill

Unfortunately, I myself did not yet claim the crater-filled hill with lions roaming all over it

*OOC: Whew! I thought you are about to destroy the hill. But could anyone not destroy a hill for, like, 10 pages?*

IC: "Ladies and Gentlemen, let the Seventieth Hunger Games begin!" (I really liked the Hunger Games...)
